Class Taxation

java.lang.Object
Taxation
public class Taxation
extends java.lang.Object
This class stores and provides functionality for rates and income portions.
Since:
1.0

  • Method Details

    • getNumTaxBrackets

      public static int getNumTaxBrackets()
      Gets the number of tax brackets for all the income ranges.
      Returns:
      returns the max bracket that an income corresponds to

    • maxIncomeTaxBracket

      public static int maxIncomeTaxBracket​(Family f)
      Gets the max bracket that a family's income belongs to, based on their filing status as well.
      Parameters:
      f - The family involved in the max bracket calculation.
      Returns:
      returns the max bracket a family falls into.

    • bracketIncome

      public static float bracketIncome​(Family f, int b)
      Gets the portion of income that a family's taxable income falls into.
      Parameters:
      f - The family involved in the bracket portion calculation.
      b - The bracket number that determines the income portion.
      Returns:
      returns the portion of income that a taxable income falls into.

    • bracketTaxRate

      public static float bracketTaxRate​(int b, int f)
      Gets the corresponding tax rate based on a bracket number/filing status
      Parameters:
      b - Represents the bracket number
      f - Represents the filing status of a family: 1 = single, 2 = married filing jointly, 3 = married filing separate.
      Returns:
      returns the corresponding tax rate based on bracket/filing status.

    • getIncomeRange

      public static IncomeBrackets getIncomeRange​(int b, int f)
      Gets an object representation of a certain income range based on bracket number/filing status
      Parameters:
      b - Represents the bracket number.
      f - Represents the filing status of a family: 1 = single, 2 = married filing jointly, 3 = married filing separate.
      Returns:
      returns the object representation of a given income range.
